hasVariant.description: Buy the Julbo Fury Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I haven't wiped out, I haven't dropped these, I've been very ginger with them, but go figure, I'm already seeing scratches on the finish (from dragon flies??). Disappointing since as those scratches accumulate, it'll be more and more difficult to see through them. I had to retire my last pair of Julbos due to that, and I just got these in September. Here we are in November and I'm heartbroken. 

I love the scale of the frame and how well they vent and protect my eyes from all the things on trail. But I definitely will need to be able to see, so these expensive goggles are going to be replaced sooner than later.

This is my last pair of Julbos... so sad.
review.name: A lot to like, but scratches easily

name: Fury Sunglasses

review.itemreviewed: Alpine Onset Merino 150 Hooded Baselayer Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great base layer. Recommended for windy days with precip. Using for running and ski touring
review.name: As described

review.itemreviewed: Alpine Onset Merino 150 Hooded Baselayer Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: Material is soft, not scratchy. The color & pattern ("fresh mint floral") are really cool - the light blue background is a little darker in person than the photos which I like. This is a thin weight wool - nice as a base layer or alone on a mild day.
review.name: Pretty pattern, soft wool

review.itemreviewed: Alpine Onset Merino 150 Hooded Baselayer Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is a great baselayer. I wear it while winter backpacking in the desert. It is nice and long in the torso and sleeves, which works well for my 5'10" frame. The material is breathable and quick to dry. For my purposes, the hood is not terribly useful as it is tight, more of a balaclava, but I do enjoy the extra material at the neck for keeping warm. I also enjoy the pattern, it's a nice break from the ubiquitous solid-color base layers.
review.name: Great all-around base layer

review.itemreviewed: Alpine Onset Merino 150 Hooded Baselayer Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are by far the best base layers a girl could ask for! Very warm but breathable.
review.name: Best. Base layer. Ever.

review.reviewBody: These have plenty of zippered pockets and came with a liner with perfect padding. My partner accidentally put both the shorts and the liner in the dryer on low and they both heavily shrunk. The material on the inner thighs also is starting to show wear from the heat. Got two wears out of them and loved them but unfortunately they’ve shrunk a whole size down and are no longer wearable (by me anyway). Follow the care instructions exactly, they’re not messing around.
review.name: Great shorts, do not put in seyer

review.reviewBody:
Overall good quality. Don't feel too heavy or restrictive. 

Lots of pockets and comfortable on the bike. Seem to add a touch of protection. 

I usually wear a pair of bibs under them instead of the included click in liners. The included liners are ok though. I like the click in aspect of the included liners. 

A bit hot for Louisiana summers. 

The belt is a bit cheap feeling but is functional and the belt loops are big enough to fit most belts.
review.name: Good shorts.

review.reviewBody:
Really like these, so much that I bought a second pair.

Pros:
Over a thousand miles on the two pairs now, no visible signs of wear on the shorts and only slight wear on the liner. 
Great pockets. Plenty of them. 
True to size on the shorts for me. 

Cons: 
Not to sound silly, but the liners could use a little room in the thighs. Compared to my other ~10 mtb and road kits, these are probably the tightest of them all. 
Wish the shorts were a little shorter. But that's on me -- the dims are in the listing.
review.name: Great short. Plenty of pockets, durable

review.reviewBody: The reason I bought this pair was because it has front pockets with zippers, other than that I do not like this short, the outer shell is correct size but the Liner is too small, it is very restrictive and harsh right above your knee you feel a sandpaper with  every stroke.
review.name: Feels like you are wearing sandpaper.

review.reviewBody:
I really like these shorts as they have great zip pockets for holding keys, phone etc.
Also, they are really solid, well built shorts and will work in temps not cool enough for pants but not so hot that you need light shorts.  The liner is one of the best I own and I'm very satisified with the purchase.  Recommended highly.
review.name: Great Short

review.reviewBody: I bought the black tone on tone camo version. Cool alternative to just standard black. Like the short a lot. Good weight to the fabric, feels durable, but not hot. The liner is nice too, with many places it attaches to the outer short if you like that or can be un-snapped to ride more "free" (my preference).
review.name: Good Short

review.reviewBody:
Pros: 
Not too long
Very tough
Not too hot for hot days
Tons of functional pockets
Liner is thin with foam on the denser side
Don't hang up on my saddle

Cons:
Very baggy 
Too many pockets?
Liner could be too thin for some
review.name: Solid choice
comment: I have the grey and black - The gray material is not fit for purpose, it has wrinkled and deformed, very strange. I have a replacement pair sent from Endura and they did the exact same thing!

review.reviewBody: These are the perfect hiking boots! Let me back up and say I started out with the lone peak hiking shoe and I have used those for years. I loved everything about them, until it came to hiking the rocky and sandy parts of my home state. My ankles didn't have the support needed with the shoe. I cannot tell you how many times I rolled my ankles. Anyways, I loved the shoe so much I decided to buy a hiking boot through altra. Due to the hot weather conditions in my home state, I needed something light weight and breathable. Enter the lone peak boot. Now, the material is thicker than the lone peak shoes to add extra protection, as it should, but that means it fits a little smaller than the shoe. I had to go a whole size up from my lone peak shoe to get the perfect fit for the boot. (I ordered 3 different boots sizes trying to find the right size. Altras return/30 day trial was amazing for this situation!). My ankles are now protected and supported and I have not had a single rolled ankle! That being said, this is not a heavy duty boot. I would suggest checking out some of their other boots if you are looking for a thicker sole or sturdier material. However, I have taken them on a few 7 miles hikes in very rocky conditions and have not had a single rip or tear in the material. I HIGHLY recommend this shoe to everyone: family, friends, even strangers!
review.name: Altra Fan for Life

review.reviewBody: Never mind what others are saying. This is shoe is comfortable, easy to put on, light weight, and not hot. The problem with this shoe is that you can feel every rock and stump in the ground with hiking. So a great boot for easy terrain, but your feet will not be happy if you are hiking on stumps and small gravel all day. Would be 6 stars if they made a version of this with a bottom like a sole like a Keen. Please do and call me when you make it!
review.name: Everything great but not for stumps/rocks

review.reviewBody: Recently,hiked Bryce , Zion, southern and west rim of the Grand Canyon. They were amazing would highly recommend them again. My husband is also enjoying his pair as well.
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: the sizing is difficult fit well. I got my normal size 7.5 my toes were squished. I Exchanged for a Size 8 and the Body of the shoe is too wide for my foot and my toes slam into the shoe when I walk.
review.name: Difficult to find the correct sizing.

review.reviewBody: I really love how comfortable these are, but Altra for the love of all things hiking, PLEASE put a decent tread on these boots. I'll take a bit more weight as a trade for better tread. Horrible tread!
review.name: So comfortable, horrible hiking tread

review.reviewBody: I've really enjoyed these shoes! They're comfortable, cute and have held up very well. I do not have wide feet so at first I wondered if the toe box might be too big, but it was actually nice that my toes had a little extra space to stretch. I ordered the size I usually wear, and wore the shoes mainly for a hiking trip to New Zealand. They're lightweight and have ankle support, both of which are definitely helpful when going out on a trail. Two thumbs up!
review.name: Great Hiking Shoes!

review.reviewBody: I have purchased several of the lone peak hiker before and they have all been extremely comfortable, lightweight and breathable. This updated version is uncomfortable, extremely hot and material is very thick. Had to return.
review.name: Not comfortable

review.reviewBody: I have owned many pairs of the All weather Lone Peaks and these are not sized the same at all. I wear a 7 in normal and 8 in athletic shoes. I ordered an 8 and they fit like a true 7.
review.name: Runs VERY small

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes so much. I bought the brown but they are a strange brown/salmon color. I love the Altra brand for my feet but the styling needs a lot of work. Same with the shoes, unfortunately.
review.name: So comfortable but the colors are not great

review.reviewBody: I received this as a christmas gift and it's a bit small. They are unable to exchange the product for me. I don't recommend buying from online companies that do not have a gift or exchange policy
review.name: a bit snug

name: Lone Peak Hiker 2 Boot - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Alpine 83 Recraft Mid WP Sneaker - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love my new Alpine 83 Sneaker Recraft Mid Waterproof. I live in a location where we get rain, snow and sunshine. These shoes are very comfy and they work well in the snow and ice. The waterproof feature is great.
review.name: I Love these shoes.
comment: We love the love! Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Alpine 83 Recraft Mid WP Sneaker - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Took my Merrells to a winter trip to Amsterdam, Netherlands, when it was raining heavily, was windy, and cold. The sneakers showed it best performance - one week walking a lot in the city, my feet were dry, warm, comfy (and my knees were comfy too - love the sneaker's bouncy soil!), and never slipped, even on wet cobble stones. 
Love and recommend the shoes!
review.name: Dry, comfy, warm, not slippery

review.itemreviewed: Alpine 83 Recraft Mid WP Sneaker - Men's
review.reviewBody: We got these in the mail and husbands first time trying on the loops ripped on the back! Emailed & not no response but very disappointed because they’re so nice.
review.name: Hmm..
comment: We are very sorry to hear this and not the experience we set out to create. We do not see an email in our system under your info provided here. Please give the team a call at 800-288-3124 or live chat at Merrell.com. Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Alpine 83 Recraft Mid WP Sneaker - Men's
review.reviewBody: While I was putting the boot on, it ripped! The quality of merrell produced have significantly gone downhill over the years. I’ve had multiple pairs of boots/shoes over the years and love to support a local company, I can’t contribute to poorly made products anymore.
review.name: Poor assembly quality

review.itemreviewed: Alpine 83 Recraft Mid WP Sneaker - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I'm a bit disappointed with the quality of these.  I am a die hard Merrell fan, haven't owned another brand in about 20 years.  I went to put these on, and the loop on the heel broke off immediately on both shoes.  It makes me worry they are sacrificing quality, while keeping the cost the same. 
Other than that, they look great and are very comfortable!  Size was on point, and the support is great, more support on the inner middle part of the foot
review.name: Comfortable, but sacrificed quality

review.itemreviewed: Alpine 83 Recraft Mid WP Sneaker - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable once I found the right size. I had to size up a half size from my normal size as the toe box was squeezing my toes. Half size up and they fit like a glove. The retro hiker style is a plus.
review.name: Comfy
comment: Thanks for sharing your feedback Ryan!

review.itemreviewed: Alpine 83 Recraft Mid WP Sneaker - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are incredibly comfortable. A well made shoe, I’m a happy customer.
review.name: The most comfortable shoe I’ve had in a long time.

name: Alpine 83 Recraft Mid WP Sneaker - Men's

review.reviewBody: It’s a great knee brace and knee pad all on one. My intended use was for mountain biking to protect my knee from further injury after partially tearing ACL and MCL. It’s decent to pedal in. I wore it all day at a downhill bike park. It is designed to fit snug. I normally wear a large knee pad and ordered a large for this brace too. It is sold as a pair.
review.name: Great for post-knee injury protection

review.reviewBody: Just what I was looking for. Offers great protection!
review.name: You need these!

review.reviewBody: These are pretty great, I've only ridden in them once but they disappear and i hardly noticed them on the ride.  They will be my go to for as long as they last!

review.reviewBody: My previous pair was ribbited and peg hooks to hold the straps tight, they broke on the second ride. Troy's or all velcro and fit better, hopefully will last the test of time.

review.reviewBody: Troy Lee has top notch gear, these braces are good to go, very comfortable and very supportive, got a few rides with them now and like them a lot.

review.reviewBody: excellent protection. they sit comfortably, do not slide.

review.reviewBody:
The stem fit perfectly with my current setup. I'm a sprinter and I put it through the paces and its stiff and responsive. I purchased the -17 degree stem and its perfect for my needs. 
The only potential issue that I can see is that it uses star bolts instead of allen bolts, so it would be good to make sure that your multi-tool has the right head in case you need to make adjustments. ZIPP does provide the star bolt tool in case you do not have one already.
review.name: Quality

review.reviewBody: Light, stiff, and tasteful graphics like other Zipp cockpit components. The quality, weight, etc. are on par with prior ServiceCourse SL stems so from what I can tell this is just a design refresh. I have the -17 degree and just got the -6 degree. The -17 version makes your stem basically flat to the ground but the sharp angle looked kinda funny. The -6 degree allowed me to drop down a spacer.
review.name: Like other Zipp stuff

name: Service Course SL B2 Stem

description: Buy the Shimano RS785 Hydraulic Disc Brake Caliper online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: RS785 Hydraulic Disc Brake Caliper
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano RS785 Hydraulic Disc Brake Caliper online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These would be a great choice, but Shimano has seemed to have lost control of quality here. I have had to replace two of these now because of leaking seals. Completely unacceptable.
review.name: Two consecutive calipers w leaking seals

review.reviewBody: I ordered 2 for an Ultegra 8000 build with "post" caliper mounts.  Unfortunately, 6 months later one started slow-leaking fluid from the o-ring seal at the port between the caliper halves. It's terrible... pads are consistently glazed and loud. At first I thought my college-athlete son contaminated them, etc., but then after multiple frustrating "what's going on" experiences cleaning the pads with alcohol and sanding and ultimately replacing, I did a bit of research on line... this is well known failure mode with this particular Shimano design.  ..kind of disappointing and not their best work. In any event, rather than roll the dice here again I swapped in Hope RX4's (which by the way perform MUCH better).  I'm returning the one that is defective to Backcountry as a warranty claim and have the eat the cost on the other.  So far the process with Backcountry is a bit confusing - their service is generally excellent but they appear in this case to be set up for returning stuff bought by mistake and not for warranty issues - I'm hoping that this sorts the right way.
review.name: Okay calipers.. when they don't leak oil

name: RS785 Hydraulic Disc Brake Caliper

review.reviewBody: I bought these this summer for a 5+ day trek across Isle Royale and they were perfect for this trip.  Between crazy rain and trails that turned to rivers and mud bogs I feel like I put these pants to a serious test.   My only complaint is that after one wash (using tech wash) they are pilling a bit in places.  I plan to keep using them as a top layer when cross country skiing this winter, but I wish they still looked a bit better.
review.name: Terk tested

review.reviewBody:
These pants are amazing! I had been searching on second hand sires for the perfect hiking pants for a 4 day Trek in Peru during rainy season and these were prefection!
They aren't rainproof after being in the rain for a couple minutes but they dry out so quick, even in a humid foggy window room. They provide the right amount of protection and breathablitiy. We had to pass through mud that was mid shin and while some took there shoes off and did it, I chose to tighten my shoes and zip down my pants. I made it through with not a spec of mud on my skin and when the mud dried it just flicked off.
review.name: I want another pair please!

review.reviewBody: These were a last minute purchase since we were going to see temps in the 50's and 60's on our climb. They were great and I'm really glad I went with something lighter. The reinforced ankles are clutch and didn't rip at all during a very long climb.
review.name: Great for summer mountain climbs

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these pants! They are the most comfortable, flattering, well-made fall/winter pant! I 100% recommend them!!
review.name: My most favorite pants yet!

review.reviewBody: The bottom cuff of the pants fit sort of weird.  Too long and tight fit around the ankle which looks weird, and when the zipper is unzipped it also looks weird.  Belt is bulky under a harness.
review.name: Nice fabric but cuff fits weird

review.reviewBody: What a cool and lightweight, but durable and comfy pair of trail pants!!  Excellent choice for a hot hike!
review.name: OR Cirque Lite Pants

review.reviewBody: I have climbed and hiked in these pants. Great stretch. I got size M, feels true to size maybe slightly large. I have the belt on the tightest for regular wear but will loosen the belt if I have baselayer underneath. I am 5'4" and the regular length fit me perfectly. Usually in Patagonia softshell pants I get the short length.
review.name: Love these pants

review.reviewBody: Like the color and overall fit.  Have not worn in rain so don’t know how water resistant there will be.
review.name: Fit is good

review.reviewBody: I have limited time in them but for the couple of quick ski tours and winter hikes I have used them on they have been great. The expanding cuff just fits over my lightweight skimo boots but does not fit over my resort ski boots, otherwise they are great, light, breathable enough, and water resistant.
review.name: Great Fit and Comfort

review.reviewBody: I was so pleasantly surprised by these pants. I bought them for when it's a little too cold for my fav pants, the Ferrosi's. They don't feel too much heavier than the Ferrosi's but definitely block the wind better and are very water resistant. I wear usually wear a 16W in the Ferrosi's and the 1X fit the same in the waist and thighs, with lots of forgiveness. These are more form fitting in the calves but not restrictive because they're nice and stretchy. I could easily fit a wool baselayer under both. These are generously high wasted and sit right at my belly button. I like the zippered bottoms - I zip them for cycling but unzip them for hiking in rain or snow to act as a gaiter. I hope they make more fun colors!
review.name: Perfect Pants!

name: Cirque Lite Pants - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I'm about to buy a second pair.  The pads inside did crack as someone else posted but they lasted maybe 300 rides before that happened.  I wash them maybe every 4th ride and never dry them.

I wish the pads inside hadn't cracked as everything else is in good shape for longer use but I'm still impressed with the comfort, performance and longevity.
review.name: Great pads - comfortable & easy

review.reviewBody: I?m really happy with how these have worked out. They offer very good protection and they?re very comfortable. I don?t notice them even when pedaling.
review.name: Good protection and com

review.reviewBody: These knee pads are comfortable & the zip is really convenient, but I have the same issue many others have had. The pads don't last. Mine have ripped in half. I definitely would have liked to get more than a few months out of them. I won't purchase again.
review.name: Nice pads, not so nice quality
comment: Same thing happened to mine albeit after after 2.5 years. I just put some gorilla tape on the front of foam part to keep them together, shoved them back in the sleeve, and they work like a charm.

review.reviewBody: These are nicely made and the zipper works as it should.  Ion makes high quality gear and this is no different. I think for cool weather park riding these are fine. But for warmer weather these have no breathability. Also though they look burly, there's just one piece of foam inside which isn't very easy to remove or reinstall when washing. Given the level of protection was only moderate, I wasn't willing to accept the trade off of warm knees. Returned.
review.name: Excellent quality, little ventilation

review.reviewBody:
Oh, the joy at my newfound ability to just unzip and be out of my pads after putting the miles of riding! Worth every penny just for that part.

After watching my buddy do this very thing, I sat there and thought, I have to have a set of these for myself!

I ordered a set of extra-large. They seem to fit well. They are comfortable and stay in place. I will say the zippers make me a bit nervous as they seem to be on the smaller or daintier side of what I would prefer. I just make sure to take care of stretching them, and I am confident all will be well.
review.name: Pure post ride bliss!!

name: K-Pact Zip Knee Pad

review.reviewBody: Great fit. I like the drawstring to help support the waistband when you have stuff in your pockets. The Like the stretch in the material that moves with me.
review.name: Love these shorts!

review.reviewBody: The only problem I had was that I like them too much. They are over priced as well.
review.name: The only problem I had

review.reviewBody: Super solid for everyday use / climbing. Durable, but stretchy.
review.name: Excellent pair of shorts

review.reviewBody: Great fit and style and comfort. I really like to wide-wales. Really nice for bouldering, but the legs are too short for good fir under a harness.
review.name: nice feel and style but not great with a harness

review.reviewBody: I love these shorts. Very comfortable and have a little stretch for climbing ease… I did have to take one star off because my pup ran past me with a stick, which tore a huge hole in relatively new shorts. I ordered new ones anyways just with lower expectations of their durability.
review.name: Comfy

review.reviewBody: Purchased the lite navy corduroy version and I am very pleased with the overall look, comfort and construction. The sizing was accurate. The shorts are perfect for wearing about town given their appearance.
review.name: Well made and comfortable

review.reviewBody: They are durable without sacrificing on comfort. Strong material with good stretch allows for freedom of movement while climbing or working outside all while holding up against the elements of the crag and the trail.
review.name: Goldilocks Material

review.reviewBody: My shorts inventory has been long overdue for an upgrade, and these shorts are perfect to getting sends and looking good while doing it! It's been awhile since I've been able to get off the wall and straight to an event, but the Dirtbag shorts fill the bill for sure!
review.name: Excellent Shorts

review.reviewBody: Very comfy. Nice quality and the color is rich and true to the photos. I got the XL. I am a size 38 and the shorts are slightly loose. Fine for lounging but they slip down a bit if I have my phone and wallet in my pockets. Not sure if I should of gone down a size but the drawstring works well.
review.name: Great shorts!

review.reviewBody: Followed the fit guide and these are far too small. 31” waist and ordered a medium - fit like bike shorts. I hate sending stuff back, such a hassle.
review.name: Hard to say

review.reviewBody:
Fit is right, but shell material is sort of baggy.

Not water proof at all.  I wouldn't even say water repellent unless comparing to cotton.  

Terrible breathability.  Hands never been so sweaty.

Limited temp range.  52.5* might be the sweet spot for me, above that my hands get hot and sweat, below and they're cold.
review.name: Hate these gloves

review.reviewBody: I'm almost always a large and had to send these back for the XL. Outside of that GORE always makes a great product and I highly recommend these gloves for any cold weather riding.
review.name: Runs Small but Great Glove

review.reviewBody:
It is my second pair. I lost one last year.  Size up. I had to exchange from my normal L(Rapha, Assos) to XL and gloves still fit tight. 
Positive
Well waterproofed. Not sure about longer rides but my hands stayed dry during multiple 1 hour commutes under pouring rain. 
Negative. 
Liner should be better attached to a shell. Pulling gloves on when wet or over Assos liner gloves is not fun at all. Limited use. Too warm above 10-15C and not warm enough bellow 5C without additional liner gloves.
review.name: Good waterproof glove

review.reviewBody:
was really disapointed by these gloves. Rode my bike in 35 weather and fingers were freezing. Smart phone touch fingertips were abysmal. Never worked. Fingers were cumbersome, clunky, and not flexible (despite being advertised as good for biking).   I tried on a pair in large, didnt fit, and ordered a medium thinking they would be better, but were not.  Water resistant only plus. 

Poorly designed glove. You will need to buy a liner to make them decent for freezing temps, but that will only add to the clunky and cumbersome design.
review.name: Not worth the money

review.reviewBody: Possibly because my hands are naturally sweaty, these gloves tend to make my hands quite damp and warm in temperatures >40 degrees. Conversely, when it's cold outside (<30), my hands become totally numb. I don't think I'd purchase these again.
review.name: Two modes: hot and damp or totally numb

review.reviewBody: I'm a big fan of Gore and their gear. This glove is no exception. It's great in the wet, and in a broad range from 50 down to 30's, its toasty without making your hands sweat. The fit is perfect, I have somewhat skinny fingers and a big palm so XL is great. I had a pair before but left them in a taxi in New York...was soooo bummed I bought a replacement pair. Back to being happy.
review.name: Well made glove!

name: C5 GORE-TEX Glove - Men's

description: Buy the Therm-a-Rest Prolite Apex Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Prolite Apex Sleeping Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Therm-a-Rest Prolite Apex Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
As long as the matras stays intact it’s comfortable and very good. But as I encountered now for the second time, after replacement under warranty, the internal connection (foam-skin) breaks lose and therefore the whole matras is unuseble!
Really a quality flaw and absolutely not “Thermarest-worthy”!!
review.name: Breaking up internally

review.reviewBody: Just bought pro lite apex on 10/14/23, used a couple time, internal seperation at head. Every time I add more air I get more seperation. So my butt is on the ground and my head is sticking up. Sad part is I have more days left, nothing worst than having it fail while on a trip. Useless when it doesn't even last a year.
review.name: Very disapointed

review.reviewBody: Excellent sleeping pad. Light weight, compact, perfect thickness for an enjoyable rest.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: Unfortunately a very disappointing lifespan. I bought this three years ago and have perhaps used for five camping trips, never longer than a couple of days. Always kept the mat well cared for and never overinflated. Unfortunately I just came back from a camping trip up Snowdonia annd around 4 am was woken to the noise of the septum within the internal structures of the mat breaking. This caused a large and uncomfortable lump in the lower lumbar region of the mat. Fortunately, this was only a one night camping trip and I accepted a cold night of no sleep without a functioning mat . Prior to this issue, I had thought the mat seemed very robust and comfortable, but given the price, I would expect it to last much longer!
review.name: Joseph

review.reviewBody: I had this pad for a few years and really enjoyed sleeping on it until our last camping adventure when it ruptured internally creating an over inflated section at the head end. Pad has not been over inflated or used harshly, but on the last night (luckily) camping it sounded like it was ripping and then suddenly ballooned under my head. This seems inline with what some of the other reviews of this particular sleeping pad have experienced as well, so this is not a one off issue from what it seems. I currently have a warranty ticket in and I'm waiting to hear back, but after this issue I couldn't recommend this particular sleeping pad. We have another two Thermarest pads (old prolite model) that we have had significantly longer and used more frequently and those have been going strong for well over a decade! The Thermarest pads are great, this one may just be one worth avoiding. I'm hoping that I can replace this faulty Apex model with one of their new regular prolite models instead and hopefully get more longevity out of that instead.
review.name: Good until it wasn't - separated internally

review.reviewBody: Only a little over 6 months old and treated carefully (its an investment!". Always on a tent floor. But it began to deflate over night with it being pretty much flat by the morning. I am thinking that the days of the old robust thermorest sleeping pads are gone. Now we are left with a product that really is not suited to the rigors of outdoor use. Lightweight, yes. Packable, yes. Tough as the old ones?....No! I expected it to be at least as good as the old originals, but I am left disappointed. Durability has been sacrificed for the opther attributes. Shame really.
review.name: Deflated....

review.reviewBody: I bought the mat about 3 years ago, and although it was always used correctly, I have only slept on it around 30 times before the outer cover separated from the core. When I inquired about the warranty at my local store, I was offered the option to buy the mat again at half price. I will need to think carefully about this, as I have to consider the possibility that the mat might break again after only sleeping a few nights on it. Besides the good comfort the mat provides, my intention was also to purchase a product with a long lifespan, which unfortunately, this mat does not deliver.
review.name: Good comfort short liefespan

review.reviewBody:
Not sure why my review was removed. I had to add it again. Apologies.

 I went on a camping trip last fall. It was the first time I used the pad. I filled the pad properly and made sure the vent was in locking position to not let air escape. At first it was great, until I woke up in the middle of the first night with the pad deflated. I had to turn the valve to blow more air into it. It should not have deflated after the first use. I wish I would’ve purchased the NeoAir Top Luxe pad instead. I’m just extremely disappointed in the product. I have not used it since that night.
review.name: Deflated during first trip

review.reviewBody: I went on a camping trip last fall. It was the first time I used the pad. I filled the pad properly and made sure the vent was in locking position to not let air escape. At first it was great, until I woke up in the middle of the first night with the pad deflated. I had to turn the valve to blow more air into it. It should not have deflated after the first use. I wish I would've purchased the NeoAir Top Luxe pad instead. I'm just extremely disappointed in the product. I have not used it since that night.
review.name: Deflated itself after first use

review.reviewBody: Bought this pad as my old pad was no longer good for 3 season camping the pad is excellent although a little on the heavy side but expected for this size of pad the pad came with a compression bag but sadly not with a pump sack or repair kit which was very disappointing so will have to fork more cash out for these as although it is a self inflating pad it dose need a few more breaths to make it comfortable hopfuly thermarest will include a stuff/pump sack with this product in the future
review.name: Pro lite

review.reviewBody: Been using Rab jackets for well over 15 years.  Received this jacket today with no stuff sack.  Called Rab and sure enough, no sacks included anymore.  Obviously a cost cutting measure.  A $450 jacket should have it included.  Disappointing to say the least.  Jacket seems nice.  Looks to be about the same fill as my 10 year old Neutrino.   Will test out to see if it is warmer.  Backcountry was great to deal with.   RAB QUIT BEING CHEAP!!
review.name: No stuff sack??

review.reviewBody: It's the first coat I've ever bought where it came smelling of a couple of different foul odors...I've initiated a return immediately.
review.name: Disappointed
comment: I’m sorry to hear about the issue with your coat. We’ve reached out to you via email to assist with your return and address this concern.

review.reviewBody: First and foremost this thing is an absolute furnace, included and thick hood.  Reasonably weather resistant and light weight.  Looks and feels great, have gotten complements from strangers.
review.name: Warm, well made and stylish

review.reviewBody: Buenos días no voy a comprar la chaqueta positron pro por no poner la página en español segundo idioma más hablado en la tierra.
review.name: Comprar la chaqueta

review.reviewBody: Hola buenos días,tenía la intención de comprarme la chaqueta positron pro down.En España hay muchos montaneros y no se la intención de ustedes de poner esta pagina en español siendo el español el idioma más hablado en la tierra vamos un desprecio total para España y demás países que hablan español.Que tengan buen día.
review.name: Comprar la chaqueta

review.reviewBody: Very good.
review.name: GREAT DOWN JACKET

review.reviewBody: This is a superb quality jacket. Really warm but light. The back is long enough to cover the bum, the arms are a nice length so you can pull the sleeves down to keep your hands toasty. The material seems sturdy and there's no down/ feather escape. Highly recommend
review.name: This is a superb quality

review.reviewBody: really good coat, really warm. would definitely recommend.
review.name: really good coat, really warm.

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket for my husband who has mobility issues,and is always cold the jacket is super lightweight very warm and cosy easy to put on and has wind proof cuffs and a two way zip which can be opened from the bottom or top making him comfortable when sitting in the wheelchair top marks on all counts it's fab and red is his favourite colour amazing the fact it's recycled only adds to my delight I will buy from you again as its perfect in every way
review.name: I bought this jacket for

review.reviewBody:
A thing of beauty for outdoor types . I have just got this as a direct replacement for one I got 20 years ago and which I still use regularly .
Robust and warm .
review.name: A thing of beauty for

review.name: Nice and lightweight

review.reviewBody: Selected a large based on the waist size in the chart.  I'm at the bottom of that range and figured with ski clothes on it would be a good fit. The leg loops seemed way too loose and are not adjustable.  Hung on it and the tie in loop came half way up my chest before the leg loops engaged.  Might have tried a medium if that size was available. Went with a different brand instead.
review.name: Super Light and Compact, But...

review.reviewBody: Feels strong and comfortable for emergency falls. I wouldn't want to hang on it all day, but for a just in case scenario on a long hike it should be awesome
review.name: It is light!

review.reviewBody: When weight is concerned this is a great option however it can feel a little too stripped down at times.
review.name: Great minimalist harness

review.reviewBody: I bought this harness for work, and while I can't speak to the durability of it, I'm impressed with the size and weight. It's so convenient to pack while still getting the job done.
review.name: Couloir harness

review.reviewBody: Haven't used it yet, but it's heckin small and heckin light
review.name: Haven't used it yet, but

review.reviewBody: I needed this harness for emergency operations, such as chair lift evacuation and low angle rescue, and it does exactly what I need. It hardly takes up any room in my pack, it is light, and it is simple to put on, the latter being important while wearing winter gear.
review.name: Simple and Lightweight

review.reviewBody: Bought it got glacier travel and via ferrata tours. Super light and fits in a little bag. Akers almost no room in my pack.
review.name: Super light

review.reviewBody: Great harness. Fits accurate to size, very light and packs down super small. Very happy to add this to my pack.
review.name: Great harness. Fits accurate to

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is stylish and that's why I bought it. I read the reviews and was expecting it to be at least a little warm. It has no insulation. My daughter took it to school after I washed it and was freezing. I put it on and went out side and all the cold air just went strait through. North Face should have sold this as a summer jacket. It would be better on a summer hike up in the mountains where the temp dips to high 60s. This is definitely not a winter weather jacket. And as for layering- you would need to add a couple other layers with this to be warm.
review.name: Cute! But zero warmth!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought a size up so I could layer underneath and use it for playing in the snow. Worked perfect!

review.reviewBody: Used as an adjunct to immersive waxing. Seemed to lubricate & quite chain well. HOWEVER, after storage a partial bottle and a full unopened bottle SOLIDIFIED, therefore becoming unusable. I will add the solid contents to my wax pot. Beware!!
review.name: Short shelf life

review.reviewBody: Add this to your chain after you perform an immersive wax in your crock pot and it will make your chain silent.  Shake vigorously,  apply to each link, spin a few times, let it sit overnight, and enjoy super quiet and smooth operation for miles.
review.name: Makes the chain quiet

review.reviewBody: Rode it during Leadville 100. Can’t find dryer or dustier. It works well!
review.name: Works

review.reviewBody:
I really hoped Super Secret Chain Lube would hold up to the hype and positive reviews.  I followed the directions from Super Secret for all steps of new chain prep and lubing.  Bottom line I couldn't even get through a 20 mile ride without bike drive train problems.  I tried re-application several times and always with the same results.  So if you ride dry dusty trails this lube is not for you.  Maybe it works great on the road but not for mountain bikes.

Ibis Ripley, XT components, Southern CA summer trail conditions.
review.name: Not for mountain biking dry dusty trails

review.reviewBody: I followed the instructions on the video and thoroughly cleaned the chain. It was as clean as I could make it. Then I dipped the chain and hung it out to dry. Never had a more quieter chain before. All I do is add a drop to the links if I ride while wet. There is no complaint at all. Great product. Just follow the instructional video.
review.name: Super

name: Super Secret Chain Lube

review.reviewBody:
This jacket is my go-to....construction is outstanding, pocket placement is good, and it supports everything from full on storm days to higher level aerobic activities. I use it for skiing, snowshoeing, and winter days on the fat bike. It's nice to have a single piece that supports all my activities, and I'll be throwing it in my pack for summer rain protection. The hood design is great for over a helmet, and I've found that folding the visor in once or twice makes for a perfect fit when you don't have a helmet on. I especially appreciate the durable material choices. Wrist closures are good, and the goggle wipe is a nice add. Just about perfect for year around play in Winter Park!

Update: Just took this shell on a 6 day tour around Mt. Blanc from Chamonix. Several days with solid rain, some transitioning to snow, and the jacket never saturated. Stellar! Note: When BD says this is sized for a snow sport helmet, that means that the hood can be way big if you don't have a helmet on. There's a bungee cinch, but it has it's limits. I ended sewing a velcro patch set on the hood to reduce size and that kept the visor situated nicely and maintained visibility and dryness in steady downpours. I still LOVE this shell! It should last many seasons!
review.name: Bomber construction without bulk

review.reviewBody: True to size and stretches in the right places. There's enough room underneath to layer with the other BD pieces I own. I bought the green to stay visible on dull days. Superior quality. Really impressed.
review.name: True to size and stretches

review.reviewBody: Awesome shell with pockets for all of the things! The snow/water fall right off this thing. Highly recommend this shell!
review.name: Great fit and feel!

review.reviewBody: Got this BD recon pro jacket to replace my patagonia pow slayer jacket, 6', buck 3/4 lbs, size large, fits great, at least as good as my pow slayer, looking forward to wearing it in storm conditions next winter (true test).
review.name: replacement of patagonia pow slayer jacket

review.reviewBody: Runs a little big, would not call it trim fit or athletic fit at all, but everything else about it is incredible!!
review.name: Great tech piece!!

review.reviewBody: I recently went from a more traditional ski jacket to this shell and have no regrets. The BD Dry material is great and works as advertised. It is lightweight and breathable, but it doesn't have that "crunchy" feel that comes with many waterproof shells. The design is well thought out, with the less flexible shell portion and the more soft shell style strategically placed to both maximize weather protection and mobility. Additional details, like the removable powder skirt, internal mesh pockets and vents that are easy to zip open or closed, show that the designer paid attention to detail. Finally, I love the fit and look, and isn't how you look on the aki slipe half the battle... All in all this is a great ski shell and worth the cost.
review.name: Thoughtful design results in a great ski shell

review.reviewBody: Had the Jacket for less than 6 months with a handful of times skiing. Already Has small tear on coat. My other Ski jackets have held up longer
review.name: Doesn't Hold Up

review.reviewBody:
Runs large. I'm a 40R jacket, usually a medium but the small fit better.
Beefier jacket than all the other 3L 20k ones i tried.
Would like deeper inside pockets, but the rest of them are well placed and right sized
review.name: Sturdy, lots of features and fits well

review.reviewBody: Shoulder tore when I brushed by a tree warranty told me to get bent.
review.name: Stretch mor like rip!

name: Recon Stretch Pro Shell - Men's

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of Korkers and I love them. Several years ago I got a pair at a local fly shop going out of business sale. I got the last pair they had. They were a size too big to begin with. My ankle would twist in them sometimes when walking on bigger rocks. I decided it was time for a new pair when it was time to get a new pair of good waders (because my old ones leaked like a sieve). These Darkhorse boots are a perfect fit and my correct size thank you to Korkers sizing chart. The boa system works better than the other pair I had. My ankle is supported a lot better too which makes walking in them so much better and easier.
review.name: Love these boots

review.reviewBody: On the plus side: the ease of putting these boots on and taking off almost outweighs the disadvantages, which are: the weight of the boots increases astronomically in sloppy, muddy conditions-and in a quicksand situation almost makes it impossible to pick your feet up due to the holes in the sole which fill up and hold your feet in place.
review.name: Interesting technology

name: Darkhorse Wading Boot - Women's

description: Buy the Black Diamond Icon Rechargeable Battery online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Icon Rechargeable Battery
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Icon Rechargeable Battery online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: It’s great to have an option to have a good rechargeable battery for a headlamp plus you can plug-in a USB to recharge your phone
review.name: Awesome addition for the headlamp

review.reviewBody: This rechargeable battery pack is a large upgrade over the stock included battery case for the icon 700 headlamp. It is lighter and feels better when wearing the headlamp than the battery case along with the inclusion of the rear facing red-light which increases the usefulness of the Icon 700 headlamp for more activities where rear visibility is needed. I would not hesitate to purchase this battery pack again, the only thing I would change is to purchase it sooner.
review.name: Upgrade from stock Icon 700

review.reviewBody: Incredible performance, just really dislike that the high power rear facing light automatically comes on solid green when using as a charging bank. Seems like a waste of energy during an emergency charge situation, not to mention I found it super annoying when trying to top off my GPS (phone) while sleeping on a route.
review.name: Incredible performance, just really dislike

review.reviewBody:
I now have 2 headlamps w/ this battery. I've used the first one for a few years work daily, and it's given me superb service. Just runs and runs between recharges.

Then I got a second light for other purposes and expect the same durability and service.

I must add though that finding this on the web sight the second time was impossible til I did a Google search that connected me to the page. I don't know why the website is so mystifying, it must have been rebuilt. I thought they maybe got rid of these great accessories, and super glad to have found it. Love this w/ the Icon 700 headlamp.
review.name: Bought twice

review.reviewBody: Works nicely with headlamp, as a backup. Highly recommended herein. Charge time checked with Solar Panel and works fine.
review.name: Icon Rechargeable Battery

review.reviewBody:
I bought that rechargeable battery not looking at the specs and expecting it to perform great in cold ( < 32F) temp but the first time that I tried it snowshoeing, the icon 700 light was weak and when the temperature reached about 27 F, the light simply was almost gone. The specs are stating that the battery is good from 32F to 104F so it makes sense but this battery is useless for me in the cold.
This is on top of the other problems mentioned in other reviews (rear strobe light not working when the battery is connected to the lamp etc). Anyway, this is a failed product. I will revert to the AA pack.
review.name: Not good in the cold

review.reviewBody: No matter how long I leave this battery on the charger it does not completely charge, nor does it hold a charge for seemingly any longer than the smaller batteries used in small lamps.
review.name: Trouble charging and holding a charge

review.reviewBody: I need to call customer support and find our why a new battery with a huge capacity dies after less than 2 hours. When I am using the factory battery pack that came with the headlamp, I get 6 hours on 4 AA's. This high capacity rechargeable pack has no capacity. Like I said, I need to call before I commit to this review. I am 110% positive they will help me resolve my issue. I will update.
review.name: Icon Battery Problems

review.reviewBody:
It's a nice rechargeable battery pack for the headlamp. Definitely saves having to continously buy batteries. Its also nice to help charge up your cell phone in cases of emergency.

The only thing that sucks is that, the power charging port is a micro. Just wish it was a c-port.
review.name: It's a nice rechargeable battery

review.reviewBody: I love this battery for its long life and that you can charge other devices from it if needed. Only con is that it is a bit heavy so I use the long cable and keep it attached to my pack instead of wearing on the head strap.
review.name: Icon Rechargeable Battery is amazing!

name: Icon Rechargeable Battery

review.reviewBody: Great rain pants. Lightweight and flexible. I love that the leg zippers come almost to the top. The zippers make it easy to take of without getting totally muddy from my boots. Finally, I'm so glad that the draw string is not some tiny bungee cord that doesn't help keep my pants up. The shoestring draw string at the waist makes for a solid fit and my pants won't fall down.
review.name: Great Rain Pants!

review.reviewBody: But they ripped on one trip up Mt Washington. What a waste.
review.name: Waterproof, windproof

review.reviewBody: I ordered a large long inseam and that’s what tag said but they measured only 32 inches
review.name: Long, too short

review.reviewBody: The fabric is certainly supple and comfortable. The fit is a bit strange with these. The pant leg width is rather billowy and loose. The length is simply off. I ordered "regular" 32" inseam, but in reality it was more like a 30" inseam, so the size chart is off. The width is "too big", while the length is "too small". Mountain Hardwear took care of the return for me, and the customer service was great. Might just be not the right pant/fit for me. Can't comment on quality, though my son's Stretch Ozonic jacket has held up well over the years.
review.name: Comfortable, Size/Shape Not for Me

review.reviewBody: I also have the previous version of these pants. I'm sorry to see the newer version did away with the buckle and substituted a cheap waist drawstring. Otherwise, the pants function well in the rain or wet conditions and are good at blocking any cold wind.
review.name: Pretty good but pricey

review.reviewBody: Another case of a great shoe/hiker that didnt make enough sales with the bean counters. Longevity, comfort, consistency, value- so... lets retire the line. Every other hoka a have is a joka. Last about 4-6 months. Had the Arkali for over 2 years- replaced insoles. Yes- i am an RN. Yes i am 6'2 250lbs. Size 13... Lost my biz; cant stand how spongy and loose hokas become after some miles and time.
review.name: Beats the rest of hokas' lines

review.reviewBody: I am in the military and have used these shoes for about two years conducting ruck marches and many miles through the woods. They offer phenomenal support and are still holding up after two years.

They have been and will continue to be very capable hiking boots, extra comfortable casual footwear and even style acceptable to wear to office. This is a full Black pair. The laces extending further towards forefoot, the ankle support strap along, the protected, extra durable toecap along with the Vibram soles are just pluses on an already excellent design. Think I will have to get a one of the colorful version. Really are one of the best investment I've made in a while.
review.name: So many Positives

review.name: Not what I expected

review.reviewBody: I bought this to gain some climbing gears for my GRX gravel drive train. Reliable shifting into the 40th with running the original GRX 810 derailuer. Just had to make a B-scew adjustment. So far no need for a goat link derailuer hanger extension.
review.name: Swaped from a 11-34t to a 11-40t

review.reviewBody: Decided to convert an old Orbea Onix from a 2x to a 1x drivetrain.  I was originally looking for a SRAM 11-42 but with the bike part shortage that was a no go and also didn't like how the anodized coating would eventually look after use.  So I opted for this cassette and I don't have any complaints so far.  Looks great and works great with my Rival 1 derailleur.  Very clean shifts and overall very quiet.  Love the range and combined with a 42t chainring in the front I haven't lost any performance switching from 2x to 1x.   IMO it's definitely worth the investment.
review.name: Working great so far for my Frankenbike!

review.reviewBody: I use this cassette on my gravel bike with a 36t front chainring. Climbing is a breeze. Still going strong after 500 miles.
review.name: can't go wrong with M-8000
comment:
What derailleur do you use? The RD-RX812 (810 groupset) for MTB claims a max sprocket of 42T vs your 46T on this cassette.

Thanks!

review.reviewBody: Love these pants. I'm 6'4" and order them in 38w 34L and they fit me perfectly. I consider these a mid-weight pant very well made and comfortable. I own 6 pair of these pants in different colors. Looks great either in town or on the trail. Highly recommend.
review.name: Great pants

review.reviewBody: These are tough. I look forward to taking them camping. They seem like they can stand up to rough treatment. I like the snaps at the bottom so you can keep them rolled up.
review.name: Men's Hardware AP Pant

review.reviewBody:
As a climbing pant, 1 star. The thighs in these are very slim, no gusseted crotch, and rigid fabric. As a climber,  I work my legs a lot, so my thighs and calves are muscular, and they need room to flex and stretch. All this is a bad recipe when it comes to these pants.

Oddly enough, even when not climbing, the thighs are so narrow they actually pull down on the waist. So they haven’t been functional around town either.

I would recommend trying these on in person to ensure they’ll work for your body type and build. Then you won’t eat shipping two ways,
review.name: Not a good climbing pant

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect PNW winter coat! Warm for chilly days, but breathable and waterproof for the wet ones! Perfect combo for our PNW weather. Great for the coast to the mountains and everywhere in between!
review.name: Perfect PNW Winter Coat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lightweight, but still warm for my 7 year old. Keeps him warm and dry. I really love the option to extend the sleeves.
review.name: Perfect for Illinois Winter

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Warm and great quality. The hood stretches over the face to keep rain/snow away and the sleeves will go longer if needed. My son is nice and warm in this coat.
review.name: Recommend

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality. Runs a smidge small but fit fine. No complaints!
review.name: Great quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket is very nice, and perfect for cold MN winters.  It is well-insulated and comfortable, as is the hood.  I bought this jacket for my 11 yr old son, who is average height and thin.  The Medium was too short on his torso, came down to his belt but otherwise fit.   So we returned for a large.  He loves it.  This jacket will be his November to April jacket for the next two years.  He mentioned even the pockets are warm, for short dashes outside in frigid weather he won’t even bother with gloves.  Perfect for school patrol, sledding, cold weather hiking, skating, X/C skiing, etc.  It was -9F one morning this week and he was comfortable.
review.name: Warm and comfortable in frigid MN!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Usually buy the two in one, but found my child wearing only the fleece or the outer shell. Hope this is a good alternate. Appreciate the plain design.
review.name: Christmas Gift

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Exactly what my son was hoping for - warm and not too bulky!
review.name: Perfect for my son

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good and suitable for boys and to be used in the snow
review.name: Perfect for boys

review.reviewBody: I am still a fan of the classic. This style was my first and stilly favorite.
review.name: Classic still number 1 for me.

review.reviewBody: Love my chaos, fit well and stay on when skydiving !
review.name: Chacos are the best sandal
comment: Thanks for the love Kent!

review.reviewBody:
Check your Chacos for defects!!  I've been reading all over the internet what great sandals Chaco makes, and i can see the potential they have, but when I slipped my first pair ever on, my experience was definitely disappointing.  

The left sandal fit me ok (if not a bit tight).  The right sandal however, gave me problems right away.  The size 9 I received, felt like a size 7.   I know both feet aren't always matching sizes, but my feet aren't that wildly different!

I couldn't figure out why until I broke out the measuring tape and found that the right strap (the one that starts at the pinky-toe and goes to the back arch) is about 1 inch shorter than the one on the left.  These straps are bound to the sole, there is no give.  There is no adjusting it.  

I'll be returning these.  Z/2 9M
review.name: Check your Chacos for defects!

review.reviewBody: I love how they fit and how secure they feel with the toe loop!
review.name: Comfortable, secure fit

review.reviewBody: Like my 2 other pairs of Chacos, a nice pair of sandals. Only thing that prevented 5 stars is the too-long pull strap that flops around when walking.
review.name: Great sandals; too long pull strap.

review.reviewBody: Once you get them adjusted and broke in they are like waking in clouds. They will cut off circulation to your big toe if not adjusted correctly though.
review.name: Wish I bought them sooner
comment: Thank you for sharing your feedback Brock!

review.reviewBody: I love the sturdy soles, especially for work around and in the river.
review.name: Great river shoes
comment: Thanks for sharing PJ!

review.reviewBody: Very cool that Chaco’s gave new pair of Z2’s. Wow. Great service.
review.name: New Z2’s
comment: Thanks for sharing your experience Stuart!

review.reviewBody:
Luv the sandal comfort
 but, being in Pool - Hot Tub Repair biz I find they stink  badly when feet been exposed to water repeatedly. Looked for antibacterial sandal & couldn't find them
review.name: Smell

review.reviewBody: The Z/2 Adjustable strap classic Chaco sandal, stabilizes the big toe with a strap loop. My last Chaco Z/2 pair lasted 21 years. The Chaco quality remains.
review.name: Z/2
comment: Thanks for the awesome 5-stars!

name: Z/2 Classic Sandal - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My black version of this half-zip has been a staple for everyday, travel, golf, etc. I was excited to see it in this beautiful Carolina blue shade and find that it fits as perfectly as my original one! Can't beat this pullover for layering versatility!
review.name: Comfortable and Versatile pullover

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This top breathes really well. Plus it's super comfy!
review.name: Yes definitely

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was so impressed by this piece. It is super thin, light & packable but was so warm. I worn it hiking in 45 degree weather with 30 mph wind gusts and I was completely warm & comfortable with just this & a tee under. I would highly recommend.
review.name: Such a great layer piece

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So good, that I bought two of and was able to clear out other sub-par wool tops. Versatile, wide range of temps with the right layering. And best of all.... Multiple days of wear without stink!! IB wool for the win!
review.name: Super layer

review.reviewBody: I’ve read so many reviews on different thermals and decided to go with this one. I’m an active person and live in Southern California where it doesn’t get too cold, but cold enough where this will be perfect. I love how it’s thin, but not see through. The material is soft and feels good. Not itchy. I can wear alone or layer if I choose.  I love the half zip for ventilation when needed. So excited to add this to my closet for fall and winter. I went with a small after referring to the size chart. I am a 34B, 5’6, 133 lbs, waist is 29 and below belly button I’m a 34 comfortably. So the small fit me perfectly. If you want more of a loose fit then size up. I wanted it to be fitted for layering.
review.name: Love this thermal!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have a 200 long sleeve half zip that I wear often in cooler weather so feel that this will likely be a staple as well during Autumn/Winter. Love the versatility of the half zip and merino wool feels great next to skin.
review.name: Versatile layer but will wait for cooler weather

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like the versatility of the half zip and the weight of this thermal top. I wear it on runs, hikes, and even bikes around town. It looks nice enough for daily wear and it is functional enough for active pursuits -- so it's great if I have something social post activity. The colour is so pretty too! After initial wash, it felt snug but then loosened up. Very happy with this purcahse!
review.name: Versatile layer

review.reviewBody: I wear once and love it. Can’t wait to buy another for my kids.
review.name: Great gear

review.reviewBody: Expect more from this jacket. First flaw I found was that there is no draw string in at bottom or middle of the jacket. Unless it's a perfect fit the wind will sail up inside the coat from the bottom this is why it needs a draw string. Second flaw is the button down removable fur around the hood. If you leave it on during a winding winter day and have your hood up the wind goes through the buttons around the hood. It actually redirects the wind into your face. Needs zipper or fulll velcro attachment. I'm going to have the fur sewed on and a draw string put in.
review.name: Two Flaws the make this jacket disappointing

review.reviewBody: I like the jacket. I've used it in Germany and it has keep me warm and dry
review.name: I would buy it again

review.reviewBody: I bought this same coat 8 years ago. It was great back then. I just bought it again recently because i loved the quality of the construction of my older coat. Unfortunately the quality of this coat now is terrible . The fabric is thin and cheap even the fill is poor. Not nearly as warm as the older one. I question the 600 fill claim. This is not what I would expect from Northface. I'm going to keep my older version of this coat, even in the current heavily used condition it is still better than the new one. I'm definitely returning the new one.
review.name: Poor quality

review.reviewBody: Omg my son liked it so much especially the color is super warm
review.name: I would buy another color

review.reviewBody: Its stylish, warm, and a perfect fit. Applying the coupon made it an even better purchase!
review.name: Worth the price with coupon and will have for a long time

review.reviewBody: I've used it in our first snow! Stayed dry and warm. Great purchase!
review.name: I would buy again!

review.reviewBody: Size fits true to description. Extremely comfortable and exactly as advertised.
review.name: Perfect winter jacket!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Jacket is bit underwhelming in terms of the quality of the materials used for the price.
review.name: Just ok

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the warmth, and I was given a warranty gift card when my hem failed in my last north face (different jacket model)

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The jacket fits well, is warm and waterproof. My one issue is that the cuffs on the sleeves are shedding fibers after a few uses. Quite disappointing given the price point.
review.name: Warm, well-fitting jacket but poor quality cuffs

review.itemreviewed: Transfer Factory Dropper Seatpost - Internal Routing
review.reviewBody: This dropper with cable from Fox works perfectly for me 😎👍 no need to get the new electronic which help me got this one at a great price. This new one’s total length is shorter which let me used it in my small size frame 😎👍
review.name: Works perfectly!

review.itemreviewed: Transfer Factory Dropper Seatpost - Internal Routing
review.reviewBody: Like everyone else has said this dropper sticks down constantly, no matter what I try it always sticks, cold, hot doesn’t matter.  Oneup makes a superior dropper for 150$. This thing makes a great paperweight.
review.name: Complete trash!

review.itemreviewed: Transfer Factory Dropper Seatpost - Internal Routing
review.reviewBody: I suppose this is a great dropper. However, I returned it before using went I learned from a friend that it's under a warranty campaign in which faulty parts need to be replaced.  Backcountry sold me a faulty product and I gave my friend a six-pack for the heads up. Not okay, Backcountry.
review.name: Under Warranty

review.itemreviewed: Transfer Factory Dropper Seatpost - Internal Routing
review.reviewBody: Mine came stock with my Pivot. It did not take long to begin getting stuck in the down position. This issue is much more pronounced in the cold. And by cold I mean anything below about 45. As others said, you need to bounce your butt on it with the dropper lever depressed to get it to come up. Ditching mine for a BikeYoke.
review.name: Junk. Sticks down especially in the cold

review.itemreviewed: Transfer Factory Dropper Seatpost - Internal Routing
review.reviewBody:
I have four of these - all of them work great.  But there is a catch that everyone is talking about here.  

Fox under-pressurizes these from the factory.  Two out of my four would sometimes need help going all the way up, especially in the cold.  I took them to Suspension Syndicate who services them with a slightly higher pressure to make them work correctly.   Voila, after servicing they work perfectly. 

The other nice thing about the transfer is a low stack height, so it gives you more room if you're close to full insertion depth.  The method of attaching the seat also works much easier than most.
review.name: Works great if you get it re-pressurized

review.itemreviewed: Transfer Factory Dropper Seatpost - Internal Routing
review.reviewBody:
The reliability issues with this seat post are bad enough that I would not ever consider buying one again.

My '22 Switchblade came with a Factory Transfer seat post and it hasn't worked since my first ride. It would stick in the bottom position and stop about 1/2" short of full extension when I could coax it into extending in the first place. I had a bike shop rebuild it - worked for one ride, then back to the same problem. I then had it sent to Fox for warranty service - came back, worked for one ride, then back to the same problem.

I clean the stupid thing rigorously after every ride and coat it with chain lube before every ride, and it still sticks in both bottom and short of the top positions. The cherry on the sundae is that when I had it sent to Fox, a bike shop sold me a non-Factory Transfer seatpost, and that one developed the same sticking problem in the span of 3 rides.

Save yourself the trouble and buy literally any other brand. I look forward to throwing both my crappy Transfer seatposts into a hot campfire.
review.name: Trash

review.itemreviewed: Transfer Factory Dropper Seatpost - Internal Routing
review.reviewBody: Had the dropper on for about 2 months and the post stopped extending the last inch or so. Today, all of the oil just leaked out from the bottom of the frame. A lot of people seems to have the same problem.
review.name: Dropper broke 2 months in

review.itemreviewed: Transfer Factory Dropper Seatpost - Internal Routing
review.reviewBody: My wife and I have these on our bikes, they came from factory (Pivot), they worked great for about 3 months, then the issues started. We did the recommended "fixes" checking seat post clamp torque, applying a light coat of lubricant, Slick Honey, and nothing has changed.  I find it ironic that the kashima coating would stick, maybe that's not the issue, but it certainly hasn't prevented it from sticking. It sticks in both directions. We are "fair weather" riders and keep our bikes very well maintained. We are very disappointed and will look to replace them. Talking with others, and bike shops it seems to be a known issue with these.  We have LEV on our fat tire bikes, and they are fantastic.  Hopefully should you decide to purchase these, you will have better luck than we have.
review.name: don't waste your time with this!

review.itemreviewed: Transfer Factory Dropper Seatpost - Internal Routing
review.reviewBody: I have the previous version on an older bike and not had a single issue with it for years. I have a 150 and a 175 of this model and they are the same issues... stick stick stick (very early in the purchase cycle, a few months). Has to be a poor design in my mind. Could be poor manufacturing control during covid I suppose, but man. Constantly doing a tap dance with it. to get it where I want it.
review.name: Not up to scratch

review.itemreviewed: Transfer Factory Dropper Seatpost - Internal Routing
review.reviewBody: I bought this after a few scary experiences with a mid-level post refusing to lower when it was supposed to. Turns out, even the top-end dropper posts don't work correctly. The tips they give are to increase the tension on the cable and to torque the stem band correctly. These definitely help, but it still sticks almost every time you try to raise it. To get it to raise, you have to plop down with the lever depressed to break it free. Then it raises easily. Lowering isn't an issue. The collar can't get any looser without the seat moving, and the cable couldn't be any tighter without pre-loading the post actuator, which probably isn't good for it. Really, there just isn't enough pressure to overcome the break-away friction, and there's no way (that I can tell) to increase it. It's very likely the best post available, and having trouble raising the post is much less of an issue than having trouble lowering. But the fact that the top-of-the-line option still doesn't work correctly is ridiculous. Just a little bit more pressure and this would work perfectly.
review.name: Still sticks

name: Transfer Factory Dropper Seatpost - Internal Routing
Transfer Factory Dropper Seatpost - Internal Routing

review.reviewBody: I just tried these on. I’m looking for a full zip soft shell for light ski touring and weather resistant layer for mountaineering. Some of the things I don’t like about the soft shell pants on the market are they are fairly heavy, a bit too warm for the up, and don’t have full side zips. These pants look perfect to throw over a layer, or by them selves for just about any outdoor pursuit. BUT, though they have two zippers on the side zips, one at the top, one at the bottom,  they do not have a button or Velcro top or bottom to hold pants together should you open up side zips during activity. Pants are comfy. Zips feel nice. I want to love these. But I’d need to buttons or Velcro’s on zips so I can open up and vent without pant falling off or flapping about. So close… These will be great for anyone who just needs to thrown on or take off quickly over a later. But not sure about venting.
review.name: So Close or Perfect Depending on Needs

name: Kikut Full-Zip Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: The wool keeps you warm, but doesn't trap the moisture from your sweaty feet. Any odor magically disappears when you air them out. They will shed for the first few weeks.
review.name: Best Slippers Ever

review.reviewBody: I ordered the "Shoe Rubber Slipper" and couldn't be happier.  My high instep makes it a bit difficult to put them on....I need to use a shoe horn, but they'll loosen up with wear.  They're toasty warm, I would say they ever so slightly run small to true to size and I would highly recommend.
review.name: My Glerups

review.reviewBody: I?ve been looking for a pair of slippers for awhile. These are perfect comfortable fit well for my narrow feet. Highly rec
review.name: Great slippers

review.reviewBody:
I have had these slippers for about 2 years, and they have been used every day. I purchased a size 43, but if I were to do it again I would go with a 42. The shoe is like a warm pair of socks with a reassuring grip from the leather sole. My only complaint is the shedding never truly ends. After the first month, 90% of the shedding has been reached. But over the past 2 years, I have found the teal-blue wool shedding to this day. To be fair it's in little pills, and the shoe looks and feels exactly the same, but still somewhat annoying.

I 100% would buy the slippers again, just be aware if you are a neat freak... These shoes may cause some stress.
review.name: Long lasting, but forever shedding

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a slipper that didn’t make my feet sweat. I found that slipper. Perfect fit with my orthotic insole. It was limited selection in my size 10 so I chose Petrol with leather bottoms, turns out I like that color. So far no itching. My feet love these slippers. Finally found a great slipper.
review.name: Finally I’ve found a great slipper!

review.reviewBody: I have had my Glerups for many years and they are holding up beautifully!  One recommendation I would make?if, like me, you need more arch support, insert insoles into your slippers and voila! they are perfect and even a little warmer. I think the insoles create less wear and tear on the leather bottoms as well. Try it!
review.name: Insert insoles for more arch support

review.reviewBody:
Get these if you?re looking for an indoor-only shoe and your floors are relatively clean (if not the leather soles get dirty real quick). If you go in and out of your house often (say to take your dog out), your floors aren?t super clean, or you just want something that will last longer than a year then get the rubber sole.

I'm an 8.5 and the size 39 fit true to size, however, if you have wide feet the opening on these might be a pain so get the slip-ons instead.
review.name: Wish I bought the rubber soles instead

review.reviewBody:
I've had these for a little more than a year and have literally worn them every day since they arrived. If I'm home, these are on my feet. They obviously get a lot of wear, but after 9 months or so they started to develop holes in the toes and the stitching began ripping in the back heal. Now, a bit over a year in the leather sole is beginning to tear and these are just about trashed. 

On one hand, I'm not surprised at the wear given how often I wear them, but on the other, I only wear them indoors, so the fact that they only lasted about a year gives me pause, especially at this price point (for comparison, a pair of LLBean slippers lasted about five years before they needed to be replaced). 

Given how comfy they are, I might just have to accept the fact that I'm tough on my house shoes and replace them each year, although for the next pair I might try the rubber-soled version to see if they are more durable.

For reference, I wear a 9/9.5 and bought these in a 40.
review.name: Good, but not for a lifetime

name: The Shoe Leather Slipper

review.reviewBody:
The size is perfect for my phone (Galaxy s10e) and I really like the internal divider and zipper pocket. Unfortunately every time I used it, I ended up with moisture on my phone screen. I never had it in the rain, so I assume it was sweat from being in my jersey pocket. I contacted Muc-Off and they said that it is rainproof, but not waterproof. I still think it should be able to keep sweat out on a dry day. I have another bag/case that I used in similar conditions and never had the problem with moisture.

Two stars for the design, but can't rate any higher since it doesn't keep moisture out.
