review.reviewBody:
I put this thing through its paces this past summer. Went with a size large and glad I did. I've got like a 59cm head, and I'm at the very top end of most mediums (my Bell Sixer included), large in POC. Large is perfect and I ended up going with the thicker cheek pads for my smaller jaw.

Nice open design for airflow, kineticore technology is lighter and simpler than MIPS, and thankfully didn't actually have to put its safety features to the test. Clean lines, good track for goggle strap to adhere, wide face opening.

Even without a dial retention fit system, this thing stays put even through those technical sections, rock gardens, jump lines, and drops. It's very breathable and manages moisture very well; I'm not a heavy sweater but hate sweat dripping into my eyes and never have any issues there.

Visor is fixed-position, but in an optimal place where I never really want to adjust it.

If you're looking for a comfortable full face with the right safety features and great breathability, this is 100% the move.

#BackcountryGearheads #CompetitiveCyclistGearheads
review.name: Well Done - Common Lazer W

review.reviewBody: Lazer was able to dial in an extremely comfortable helmet that is lightweight and breathes well, while still offering the highest level of protection. I've loved riding in this helmet, except for the pads along the jaw-line, of which are interchangeable, have broken clips after a use or two. Included are two sets of pads, one large, and one small, to dial in your fit, I tried swapping to the larger size, and the plastic pins broke off inside of the helmet. This is not the biggest deal, but frustrating in some manner. Just make sure to be gentle on them, and not make my same mistake. Overall this helmet is just right for riders like me who are looking to do some occasional bike park or enduro riding, and keep things light and comfy like we're used to with half-shell helmets.
review.name: DH-Certified with Enduro level comfort

review.reviewBody:
The one thing that would have made this a 5star helmet - its missing a fit crank/dial most modern helmets have on the back of the helmet for a better customizable fit. I was on the low end of a medium (56-57cm with a more oval shaped head) but needed to size down to a small for the right fit and use the larger cheek pads to dial it in, the medium was just too big which is rare for my head size. 

Once I got the right size I am pumped on this helmet. Magnetic buckle system is a must, just makes things soooo much easier. I have not used it with a neck brace but love that it has that compatibility if needed and like mentioned, its a very ventilated helmet.

Solid lid!
review.name: Lightweight, great ventilation, clean!

name: Cage Kineticore Helmet

review.reviewBody: These gloves are well made, warm and cosy.  The middle setting is great for below freezing temperatures
review.name: Warm hands at last

review.reviewBody: Awesome glove/mitten liner that keeps my hands warm on the coldest of days. They are pretty light-weight for mittens with built in batteries. Hestra products rock!
review.name: lightweight and incredibly warm

review.reviewBody: My daughters asked what I wanted for Christmas, so they got a gift certificate for me!  I ordered these for skiing, and the most recent was at Winter Park, the temps were about 10 all day, with flurries.  My hands stayed toasty!!  I start on the lowest when I'm getting boots, skis on and head to the lift, then I up the temp to medium.  Most recent ski day, I needed to use the high rating.  They are wonderful! I should have done this years ago.  I got frostbite on many of my fingers years ago driving home in leather gloves in an old Jeep Wagoner that did not have great heat for single digits.  These mittens are bit bulky due to the batteries on the inside cuff, but after a couple of uses, I'm able to pull them on and off quickly.  You do need to have an outside shell mitten to put over the mittens to protect the puffy "liner".  Batteries take 8-10 hours to fully charge, so plug them in at dinner time and they will be ready for an early morning trip to the mountain!
review.name: Wonderful, warm mittens

name: Heated Liner Mitten

review.reviewBody: Very well made but not very useful. The screws fall out, they don’t nest together well when rolled up. I was hoping thing pouch would really help keep my screw more organized, protected, and secure. It does none of those thing. 10/10 DO NOT RECOMMEND!

review.reviewBody: I use the ice screws for my ice fishing adventures and this pouch provides a perfect storage solution.
review.name: Awesome storage pouch for ice screws!

review.reviewBody: I bought 2 of these ice screw rolls because I liked them so much. They are super durable and packable. My ice screws are kept sharp and protected while keeping all the vulnerable stuff in my pack protected from the pokey parts on long approaches.
review.name: Perfect Protection

review.reviewBody: I needed my ice tools to be safely stowed in my gear closet and when they’re traveling, this is perfect for that.
review.name: Exactly what I needed

review.reviewBody:
A couple small design tweaks and this could be a solid piece of kit.
There is enough room in between screw slots where you could fit 6 more screws if they were inserted from the other side.
Also, the addition of flaps that fold over the hangers, before you roll them would keep everything in check. 
I’m bought two of these, but after loading one with screws, I realized that I will not be using them.
review.name: Could be a better design.

review.reviewBody: Reasonable solution to storing those sharp items cleanly.
review.name: Just right to keep ‘em tight.

review.reviewBody: Keep organized and protect your much more expensive investments. Nothing worse than struggling to get a screw started while pumped, eliminate this by protected your screws in transit.
review.name: Protect your screwing!

review.reviewBody: Perfect way to store my screws and keep them in top shape.
review.name: Fantastic

review.reviewBody: I bought it cause I like the name, lol, actually it is the most functional ice screw holder I have found and at a great price, can't go wrong, definitely worth it!
review.name: Ice ScrewUp

review.reviewBody: Just what you need — protect everything else in your pack from your screws. Well made, closely securely, easy to use with gloves.
review.name: Simple, reasonable priced, bombproof.

review.reviewBody: Unsure about people having sizing issues as these are the same as they have ever been. 30 inch waist fits like a 30 inch waist. Seem durable and fit well. Points off because stone color which looks gray in BC pics is actually 0% gray and are 100% tan.
review.name: Same as they ever were

review.reviewBody: I am 6 feet 190 lbs and wear a size 34. I bought the size 34 of these and they are massive. At least a size 36 waist, if not bigger and they go down to my shins. They are just crazy big.
review.name: Sizing is crazy

review.reviewBody:
I just got a pair and their sizing chart is bizarre.  It says, for instance, that the size 30 has a 32" waist.  That should have been a red flag, I guess.  So I ordered the size 30, thinking it would fit my 32" waist.  Alas, no.  The size 30 has a 30" waist.  So why do they call it a 30, then say the waist is a 32", when it's actually a 30??  No idea.  

Quality seems to be "okay," but not exactly the gear I think is going to last me for years.
review.name: Don't believe their sizing

review.reviewBody: The snap button just doesn't want to stay buttoned.  Had other pants with this style of snap button and same issue.  I'd buy something else.
review.name: Don't recommend

review.reviewBody: Long time skyline shorts customer, the latest generation from the 2021 season are my favorite, fits are revised, seams hold up well, liners are better than I remember and just a great short for me to do it all in...trail bike mostly, but can do the bike park in them and not feel out of place.
review.name: never let me down

review.reviewBody: First ride out, zipper fly broke. Backcountry also shipped me a weird beige color. Walnut is not the picture advertised. FYI.
review.name: Decent

review.reviewBody: The shorts seem to be holding up but the liner is absolutely the worse liner I have ever purchased. Bought 3 months ago and have worn 6 times, I have followed the wash instructions closely as I paid $117 for the shorts and liner and wanted them to last a long time. The threading in the liner has come undone and continues on each wash. I will never purchase another Troy Lee Design product ever again. I even contacted Troy Lee customer service directly and never received a response. Horrible product and worse company.
review.name: Liner threading coming undone
comment: I agree...every single TLD item seems to fall apart after a while.  Really bad quality!  I'm sticking with FOX

review.reviewBody: The MTB shorts are great. Quality made etc. Fit is good per size chart. The liner while quality runs small per the size chart. Recommend buying them separate and sizing up on the liner per size chart
review.name: Almost Perfect

review.reviewBody: ive used these for a couple of sesons . I would say they are comfortable,cool on hot days and durable. I don't machine wash or dry. Found the fit spot on except the liner was too small for the 30 in size
review.name: really good mtb shorts

review.reviewBody: The fit on these shorts is great, not too baggy and not too skinny. The padded liner breathes well and is comfy on long rides. I have two complaints however. The padded liner has some stitching coming apart after 6 uses. The shorts also are pilling pretty bad on the front after a few rides. They have not came in contact with anything abrasive so that is pretty disappointing. For the price, I would look at something different for sure.
review.name: Comfy and good fit but quality is meh

name: Skyline Short + Liner - Men's

review.reviewBody: I didn't use this product except for attempting to fit onto my Lake Mtn bike shoes. The Large size would not fit onto my size 44 unless I damaged the boots. XLarge not available presently. Though I am a roadie, I ride with mountain bike shoes so I can walk more normal, and I frequently am walking during my rides.
review.name: Seems well built

review.reviewBody: Hello.  Looks like a sturdy and well designed overshoe.  The big problem I found was that it is nearly impossible to pull over a MTB Shoe.  The way the zipper is designed makes it very difficult to pull over and to line up the openings with cleats.  I can see it can be done, but will take several minutes.  Maybe I am missing something, but big thumbs down on this design.
review.name: Nearly impossible to get over shoe

name: MT500 Overshoe

description: Buy the Chaco Z/2 Classic Sandal - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Z/2 Classic Sandal - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Chaco Z/2 Classic Sandal - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The strap is so long it drags on the ground, even after adjusting it.
review.name: Strap length
comment: We appreciate your feedback. You can have the strap shortened if needed, get started at ReChaco.com. Thanks!

review.reviewBody: They were too big. Difficult to adjust to fit my foot.  The sole inside was rough.
review.name: Best for someone else.

review.reviewBody: I have 6 pair of different colors and styles. Love
review.name: I love them. They are the only sandal I wear.
comment: We're happy you love them! Thanks for sharing Michelle!

review.reviewBody: I love them!! My other pair of Z/2's is black and white and are pretty used and dirty, so I loved the bright rainbow coloring on these! They fit perfectly and are so, so comfortable. I wear them to work everyday (plus adventures on the weekends) and I'm glad to have two pairs in the rotation now!
review.name: Amazing!!

review.reviewBody: I like how comfortable and stylish they are. My only issue is there isn't enough strap length. I have it pulled to the longest point and barely have enough room to get my foot in.
review.name: Comfy, durable but strap length too short

review.reviewBody: This is my fourth pair of Chaco sandals.  I couldn't resist the Ridge Gray Blue design, which I think is absolutely stunning!  My sandals fit well and are comfortable, now that they are adjusted to my taste.  I love the durability of Chaco sandals and the fact that they are great water shoes as well as everyday wear.  When I first received my sandals, the rubber smell of the sole was very strong, so I aired them out on the shoe rack in my entry way, rather than in my closet.
review.name: Comfortable and Great Looking Sandal
comment: Thanks Wendy! We're happy you love them!

review.reviewBody: Not a fan of the new footbed. I have 2 pairs which are. 5-7 years old which I love. I fell in love with the colors of these sandals so I thought I'd try the new thicker footbed. These have the same amazing arch support of my old sandals which is why I'm keeping them, but the thicker rubber anchoring the straps on the outside edge really rub and hit a pressure point and is painful.  I'm hoping my feet will adjust. It's probably because I over pronate and have a duck walk. People with normal foot alignment probably have no issues.
review.name: Footbed too high on the outside.

review.reviewBody: I love the colors and pattern on this sandal! Fit is perfect as usual. I am a happy customer:)
review.name: Perfect Fit!
comment: Thanks Kris! We're happy you love them!

review.reviewBody: Wonderful.  I ordered this pair to replace my previous ones which were over 20 years old.  I loved that pair but after several repairs of the Vibram soles they just wouldn't accept another glueing.  I wore them in lots of national and state parks as summer hiking shoes and they were simply the best.  I can tell the new soles are not as sturdy but they feel great.  The newer soles allow my husband, who could not wear Chacos before, to become a fanatic with several pair.  I chose this color because it was my favorite of the clearance and they are a great-looking pair of sandals.  I would have chosen this pair anyway.
review.name: Best hiking sandals ever
comment: Thanks Natalie!

review.reviewBody: Adjustable strap makes a perfect width fit possible even for my narrow feet.  Sole configuration supports walking, and even being all day on one’s feet.
review.name: Custom Width
comment: Thanks for sharing your feedback Jane.

name: Z/2 Classic Sandal - Women's

review.reviewBody: This seems like the perfect, all purpose hat for my Dad for Father’s Day. He has everything already and is, unfortunately got skin cancer, so was so so thankful to find the hat that seems to protect the skin, waterproof and is stylish to boot.
review.name: Hats Off!

review.reviewBody: Nice looking hat, the color was even better than online photo.
review.name: Great looking hat

review.reviewBody: Had to return this chapeau . I loved the features and quality but it was not at all flattering in any way on my head. A hat should flatter! (at least not look like it does not belong). My fashion advisor agreed. Alas, it was not meant to be for me. Be mindful of how it looks on your noggin my friends.
review.name: If it does not flatter return to hatter

review.reviewBody: I was a bit skeptical but then decided to pull the trigger. Glad I did, very comfortable, innovative easy size adjustability, cool sunglass holder. What more could I ask for. Oh yes, it's light weight and did I say comfortable! I know have this in my travel kit for hiking and have been using it on the golf course. If I had one recommendation it would be some custom patches offered for the front.
review.name: Innovative and Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Amazing hat. I have two of them now and bought one for my boyfriend. The adjustable strap inside makes it fit perfect no Matter what. It works especially great. On boats and windy days because it stays on perfectly. It looks adorable and has cool features like hidden pockets inside and places to put your sunglasses.
review.name: Perfect hat!

review.reviewBody: Love this hat for thru hiking the PCT. I wore my first one out & just ordered my 2nd one. My preference is the Wetlands Camo, which is difficult to find. It's essentionally a blue camo style. Love it!
review.name: Loved it, so I bought a 2nd one

review.reviewBody: I have not used it yet, but I have another brushline bucket and I really like the color of this one.
review.name: Second Brushline for the collection

review.reviewBody: Great comfortable hat. Easy to wash. This is the 2nd one I own.
review.name: Hat

review.reviewBody: Nice Hat.  The system for adjusting size is simple, innovative, and effective.
review.name: Nice bucket hat for golf

review.reviewBody:
Love this hat so much I bought a second one,
I got the mesa/juniper a month ago and been a daily wearer,,I do alot of hiking down here in Southern Arizona and its so light weight you dont even know you have it on,,love the dark underside of brim to ease the brightness,,,gets dusty down here and these hats I just run them under water and they dry superfast and keep they're shape,,,just picked up my second one cream/juniper today,,,,great hats!!
review.name: Love this hat!

name: Brushline Bucket Hat

description: Buy the NiteRider Lumina Dual 1800 Headlight online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Lumina Dual 1800 Headlight
hasVariant.description: Buy the NiteRider Lumina Dual 1800 Headlight online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I really like this light. It's super bright and easily adjusted to different brightness settings. It charges quickly and the battery lasts plenty long. As nice as the light is, the clamp seems to be a bit cheap. I haven't had any issues with the clamp per se, It's just doesn't seem super-secure. I worry about ovetitghtening it and breaking it.
review.name: Excellent light for winter rides after w

review.reviewBody: No surprise that Nite rider keeps turning out top quality products
review.name: Long battery life, simple to use

review.reviewBody: Been using this light almost daily for a few months now  because most of my rides are before sunrise.   Produces a lot of light and has ample battery to handle a 60-90 min ride at night.  I generally use it on the second highest setting to extend battery.   The full 1800 "blast mode" will only last about 35-45 min.  The toggle is really simple to use and I generally  save blast mode for the dark stretches with no streetlights.   Been very reliable so far.  The only surprise is the unit will get hot quickly on the highest setting.
review.name: Great light for early workouts.

review.reviewBody: For the size and cost, I think this is the best light I have in my quiver. I like that it has no cord to deal with or battery to position on the frame. I just simply pull it out my pack and slide in onto the handle bar mount when the light gets low. This and the mini on my helmet provide all the light I need to finish out my favorite fall rides.
review.name: I love my autumn rides.

name: Lumina Dual 1800 Headlight

review.reviewBody: I wear medium in most bike kits(I’m 5-8)  In this Pro line, I sized up by one size to Large for a similar fit.  I also ordered a Medium but it’s so incredibly tight that I’m giving it away to a much slimmer friend.  The material seems to be of good quality and the sleeves are long enough to not leave a sun-gap between gloves and the end of the sleeve like a couple of other “long sleeve” jerseys from other brands which fall short along the wrists.  Planning to use this for a few months before giving longevity update.

review.reviewBody: Good fit. Flap pockets stay flat. Not too boxy. Wear open as an impromptu light jacket, or buttoned up as a shirt.
review.name: Great flannel

review.reviewBody: Excellent quality, the shirt is comfy and the fit is great. I usually wear M but I sized down.
review.name: Excellent shirt

review.reviewBody: Fit true to size. Well made. 6 foot 180 and medium size is perfect for me. I like the length since I was planning on not wearing it tucked in.
review.name: New favorite go to shirt

review.reviewBody: I bought this because I love the voyager one shirt. The overall design is great, and very similar to the voyager one shirt. Some key differences: It's a heavier variation (better for colder climate) over the voyager one and made of cotton. It is noticeably warmer, but also doesn't stretch or breath as much as the voyager one, which is to be expected and a worthy trade off. Here's my one gripe, the pockets are a tad smaller than voyager one. As someone who uses the voyager one's pockets for work, I noticed the size change almost immediately. If they made the pockets the same size as the voyager, it'd he 5 stars from me. Good product overall though. On par for mountain hardwear 👍
review.name: So close to perfect.

name: Dusk Creek Flannel Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody:
The color on this jacket is beautiful. The style is simple and sleek. The warmth was not ideal but is meant to have a solid base layer with.

The cut for me just did not work out. Through the back and under the arms it just didn't feel right. This one might have you guessing. But if it did fit me right, I'd probably have kept it.
review.name: Beautiful color, touchy fit

review.reviewBody: I am impressed with the water resistant finish on the jacket so far, but I bought it more for the fit and function. So far, better than most soft shell jackets I've considered and better for the layering I can do with it.
review.name: Great cut, perfect technical fleece

review.reviewBody: First off, the quality of the jacket is right up there. Love the colors as well. Felt great and durable. However, fit is made for tall skinny dudes. I'm average build, 5'6. The armpits rode up so high, felt like like I was a scarecrow. Also, the jacket is long, pass my buttocks. If you're like 5'8 and above with long torso, this jacket is for you. If you got muscular arms, this jacket isn't for you. Bought the medium size and no way will I exchange for one size up because then the sleeve and everything else will be super long. This jacket is definitely between a slim and regular.
review.name: Quality material but fitting is not for the average folks

review.reviewBody: Fits well. A little loose. Very warm. I got a medium. 5’11 175lbs.
review.name: Nice jacket

review.reviewBody: I got this jacket about one month ago, so I havent had a whole lot of situations to test it out. However, so far I am extremely happy. The fit is perfect. The quality seems really flexible and durable. I'm 5'9" approx 165-170lbs.
review.name: Initial Review - very happy

review.reviewBody: Warm enough on moderately cold days and enough room to layer for colder days with a slight stretch to allow for freedom in the shoulders.
review.name: Quality soft shell

review.reviewBody: fits great. im 6 foot, 175 pounds and the medium is perfect
review.name: Very comfy, incredible pockets. Love the hood!

review.reviewBody: This is my fourth softshell jacket, so I am pretty familiar with this style of jacket.  I bought this one because none of my others had a hood.  This is the lightest softshell I have owned.  It feels like a sweatshirt.  I would rate my other softshells for use down to about 35 degrees and this one down to about 45 degrees, of course all depending on what layers you wear underneath.  Overall a great jacket, just not as warm as I was hoping.  Jacket fits great and seems really well made.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: This is the perfect jacket. It’s warm, lightweight, perfect fit, doesn’t limit range of motion, durable, water repellent, comfortable and looks great. It’s truly the perfect jacket.
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody:
I’m 6’2”, about 205 lbs. 

Size: I ordered both the L and the XL. I ended up keeping the XL. The L fit well everywhere but was a bit too tight in the arm pits. The XL is a bit on the baggy side. It fits me more like a hooded sweatshirt than a piece of technical outerwear. Nevertheless, it’s comfortable. 

The soft shell exterior feels like it should be pretty durable, though not bomb-proof like my old Mountain Hardwear Alchemy jacket. 

The interior fleece is plush and soft. 

This jacket should fit the bill for a shoulder season jacket. So far I’ve worn it in light rain (dwr was sufficient) and chilly/ windy conditions. Works very well for my intended purpose. 

Cut is fairly long. Sleeves are sufficiently long. I only wish the sizing were a bit smaller. Size L was a bit too tight in the armpits, XL is slightly baggier than I’d prefer.
review.name: Element Hoody- it’s pretty good.

name: Element Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: This is my third pair of these flops.  As a professional guide i wear flops about 90% of the time working and also when not on the water.  These perform very well and the non slip tread seems to last longer than my other 2 national brands that I also wear frequently.  They do appear a little tight from a fight perspective until they are work a few times.  I also think they run slightly on the small side compare to Reef and Olukai flops.  My biggest complaint is that they do not make them in MORE COLORS!
review.name: Great Flop for the Pro

review.reviewBody: These are great sandals.  Really well made, durable, good looking and comfortable from the first time I put them on. ( ordered mine up 1/2 size from what I regularly wear…they fit perfectly.
review.name: Comfy and sturdy

review.reviewBody: As a guide that’s on the water 200+ days a year these are the only flip flops that I own. I buy them 3 pairs at a time so I always have a pair near by.
review.name: Best flops Hands down

review.reviewBody: Love these flips. They fit great and offer good support all summer. The surface isn’t near as slick as other flips so there is less of a chance of slipping off and ripping your big toe off. Haha if you know you know.
Simms sandals last! Had my last pair for 8 plus years. I would still be wearing them but they disappeared.
Excellent fit, support and comfort - bought a second pair.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: Excellent flops for a day on the boat or a day on the beach
review.name: Favorite flip floos

review.reviewBody: Have a pair in every color.  Very comfortable and durable
review.name: Flip flops

review.reviewBody: Runs true to size. Unique for a flip to have arch support. Easy to wear all day! 5th pair I have purchased.
review.name: 5th pair of these

review.reviewBody: Love these flops. Should have got the other colors as well

review.reviewBody: Amazing grip and support. Fantastic support. For some of the travel I was hauling a 40 lb pack. These were warm, but my feet did not sweat, and my feet never got wet from occasional treks through knee deep snow. They are incredibly comfortable.  Very short break in period. They do run small. I ordered half size up. They are not as heavy as I expected them to be given what they are. They are certainly not light, but I did not feel that I had hauled around heavy boots all day after hiking. I strongly recommend these boots if you are looking for something to keep you warm in cold and snow while hiking relatively steep and rough terrain.
review.name: Amazing boots

review.reviewBody: Adding to the chorus - these are one of the best pairs of boots I've owned. Comfortable, light weight but supportive, and built for the snow and cold. The soles provide good grip, the fit is like a hiking boot, so your foot doesn't slide around inside the boot. From shoveling the driveway to winter hiking to sledding w/ the kids, they're the perfect winter boot.
review.name: Love These Boots

review.reviewBody: This boot...These boots...THESE boots go above and beyond all expectations I've ever had for any boot. I've been so brainwashed, like others, by only buying Nike, Timberland, etc. No! This boot design is surpasses anything that we see on the shelves at our local shoe stores. It's snug, comfy, warming, supportive for my feet, stylish, and lightweight. They are stiff but I feel like I'm gliding. I love these boots. If I hadn't landed a decent job by the grace of the Father, I wouldn't have ever been able to afford a pair of boots like this. Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!
review.name: AWESOME SAUCE
comment: Just ordered my 2nd pair in two years.These boots are the best thing since sliced bread.I use them as a carpenter so I beat my boots up pretty good.Great product

review.reviewBody:
I'll start by saying we are returning these for a larger size and shorter shaft. 

So, the look of these boots is a huge draw over the rubber boat of a foot in a lot of proper winter boots. They /are/ very techy looking, but that all comes down to what you prefer. These were for my husband. He goes 5'11", 170, and wears a 10.5 US on average in dress/joggers/hikers. He has narrow feet and likes footwear tied tight. 

He likes these boots, but says they are just a bit too small, especially with a thick wool sock. Another note that isn't necessarily a deal-breaker is the fact that they are a stiff boot both in the shaft and foot; Neither flex very well. This is not uncommon in any boot, but the breaking-in period is an unknown. The taller shaft adds to the feeling of inflexibility. As these have been noted to be a hiker, that stiffness is not a bad thing, particularly in the snow where footing can be sketchy anyway. The sole is super chunky.

If the 11's with the 8" shaft fit properly, these boots are going to be the keepers. I would say they are trues to size, but if you're straddling sizes opt for the larger.
review.name: Fingers crossed!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Stylish, comfy, and a beautiful color. I ordered a small, my usual size for North Face, and it fits on the tight side but perfect for this type of snow pant.
review.name: Stylish and comfy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfy, look cute too
review.name: Cute

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm 5'6" and ordered the short and they are perfect. Not super wind protection but they are fleecy and warm on the inside.
review.name: Great ski pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really love how the pants fit and they are so comfortable on and of the mountain
review.name: I would buy this product again and recommend to anyone

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The best pants I ve ever try, perfect for skiing
review.name: I would buy this product again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love it so much! My favorite ever. Fit really good and very comfortable. Got so many compliments.
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wore these pants on top of a pair of wool leggings pretty much every day of my two week vacation in Iceland and Finland. They really do block the wind and I stayed warm. I like that I could wear them around town and they looked more like normal pants than bulky snow pants. I wouldn't wear them snowmobiling in 20°F or below though. I wore insulated snow pants for that instead.
review.name: Flattering and functional

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fit and look is flattering, like the color my friends can pick me out easier on the slopes
review.name: Must have

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really like these pants. The only issue is the fit - They fit great except for the waist sticks out. I had to sew in a tuck. They're also a little baggy on the inside of the crotch.
review.name: Great but for a strange fit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are my ultimate favorite I have medium and large! I wear the medium when it's chilly to ride horse in. I wear the large when it's much colder with the 160 tights underneath. So so so versatile! Not bulky!
review.name: I've already bought 2 pair!!!

review.name: Low quality
comment: Hi. For any inconvenience, we apologize. We're happy to reassure you that a case has been opened to address your worries, and we're looking forward to hearing from you. Check your inbox!

review.reviewBody:
Arch support: Check
Customizable Fit: Check
Tough grippy outsole: Mostly check. not so great on wet rock, but very little that isn't sticky rubber is.
Lace loops that last longer than one hike: Erm...

Lots of potential to be a great shoe. I really like the xt-6s for walking my dog in the woods so I decided to give these a shot. Broke em in for 50 miles or so before wearing them on a hike of the pemi loop in New Hampshire. 

Day 1 had us walking through some streams on trail and on day 2, a couple miles into the morning, both shoes suffered the same failure, and the laces ripped through the lace loops. Ended up getting blisters in both feet on the same spot on on the ball of my feet for the remaining 10 miles which wasn't ideal. 

When I came home, what surprised me even more is that the xt-6 have little plastic protectors to stop just this from happening, so it felt odd that a hiking shoe wouldn't have them. Seems like an easy fix to make these a great hiking shoe for those that like the salomon fit and want something light and tough.
review.name: Lots of potential and one large flaw
comment: Hello, I appreciate you sharing your ideas with us. We constantly work to get better! Please keep in mind that your suggestions are being taken into consideration!

review.reviewBody: Bought these to be my everyday shoes, Needed something versatile enough for spontaneous long walks, and something that looked casual enough to be an every day trainer. Perfect! I also have plantar fasciitis and I knew from my Quest 4D hiking boots that Salomons insole shape and ortholite insole are really comfortable, supportive and alleviates my plantar fasciitis symptoms really well.
review.name: Comfortable,supportive and look great!

review.reviewBody: Second pair of Solomons bought this year, nice tight fit and what I expect with the draw string models. Only thing I would say is they are more flat footed compared to the XT-4 models, but this is a walking shoe not a running shoe. Higher arch would be better but otherwise they look awesome and very unique.
review.name: Nice walking around shoes

review.reviewBody: It is an excellent hiking shoe with great grip and comfort. I just wish they would make other legacy models in a 14!!!
review.name: Extremely Comfortable

review.reviewBody:
Hi there,

I’ve been using this shoe for a little over a month for hiking and walking uses. I love how grippy the shoe is and how good it looks. The speedlace is also an added bonus! 

While I’ve owned many pairs of Salomon Shoes with speedlace, I’ve never had a speed lace fail. I’ve had 2 pairs of these shoes and both have broke within a month on the speed lace grommet. Salomon has warrantied my previous shoe but it is still annoying. Beware that your speedlace grommet might rip out in the first month!
review.name: Excellent shoe but bad quality.
comment: Hello, I appreciate you sharing your ideas with us. We constantly work to get better! Please keep in mind that your suggestions are being taken into consideration!

review.reviewBody: The Salomon X ultra 360 edge has recently become one of my favourite shoes. I went on a few hikes with them and the grip and comfort have definitely impressed me. The grip provides a lot of traction allowing me to feel comfortable and safe on rocky terrain. The comfort enables me to wear the shoe all day and enjoy my hiking experience. Along with hiking I use this shoe as an everyday walking shoe as there is a lot of support and they are very comfortable. Overall this is a highly versatile shoe and I definitely recommend it.
review.name: Amazing shoe

review.reviewBody: I am a long time Salomon Shoe owner.   I've hiked over 600 miles in the X Ultra 3's, hiked hundreds of miles in the X Ultra 3 Goretex Mid's, and run countless trail miles in several iterations of the Speedcross Goretex.   When it was time to replace my X Ultra 3's for hiking sections of the AT, I tried the new X Ultra 4 but did not like the fit.  This year I saw the X Ultra 360 Edge and I ordered them.   I loved them...the fit was great, like my X Ultra 3's, but maybe a roomier toebox.   I took them on my recent 130 mile AT Section hike.   At mile 110, one of the laces cut through one of the eyelets, leaving me with a shoe that could not be tightened.  When I got home I compared the eyelets on these shoes to my other Salmon shoes, and all of my other shoes, the eyelets are reinforced with plastic tubing...on the X Ultra 360 Edge, they are simply fabric.   If you're not the type to put big miles on your hiking shoes, these may work for you, but for my needs it looks like I need to start looking for different alternatives.
review.name: Great fit, poor durability

review.reviewBody:
So as someone with a long history of wearing XA pro and X Ultras for hiking 14ers in Colorado, I was excited to try out these new 360 edge.
The good: comfortable upper with outstanding X ultra outsole. Definitely a bit more mid soul cushion, then traditional X ultra. Better overall feel then ex-ultra 4s. 
The So So: used to love speed lace system, but I’m finding that it tends to come loose more so than in the past. Not awful, but not great. Could still used more width in forefoot and toe area. Doesn’t need to be Altra wide but more than this, especially as perimeter rand doesn’t stretch much on these. Would still like to see a softer more comfortable mid sole, something with nitrogen infused foam. Doesn’t need to be super thick just bouncier. 
The Bad: Seriously Salomon, 99% of the people will use this for hiking and outdoor walking WHY such a high heel toe drop?? Having such an aggressive drop like so many Solomon shoes do, forces your foot forward, jamming toes into an already narrow toe box. No hiking shoe need more than a 4 mm drop. Listen to your reviews Solomon and stop the drop!  Lastly, Solomon has started using cheaper Ortholite insoles versus the ones they previously did. These insoles are a lower quality and do not have the perimeter transition foam around the edges like the old ones. For shoes this expensive just use the good  Ortholite insoles.
review.name: Getting Closer!

review.reviewBody: Super comfy, the arch support is either a love or a hate so please know your own preference before buying, only think I'd say is to definitely half a size up for a more dynamic fit in the shoe, but it's a fab show to walk in all day without any pains.
review.name: Great shoe

review.reviewBody: Have tried a couple of carriers from different brands. Thule sapling is the best one! Our baby likes it. I'm super happy with its design, even though it's not the finalist of IF design.
review.name: the best baby carrier for hiking

review.reviewBody: Good quality and confortable! Worth to buy!defenetl recommend
review.name: Good buy

review.reviewBody: We go to amusement parks, long rucks, hikes, family walks etc, and we use this each time. There is so much storage, we packed snacks, diapers, wipes, bottles of water, our wallets, phones, and still had some room. My daughter has used this for the last two years, and she gets excited to get in it. My husband and I take turns on rides at amusement parks and we easily switch the carrier without issue. It is well balanced, and when adjusted correctly, it should not cause discomfort.
review.name: Favorite baby gear

review.reviewBody:
My baby seems extremely comfortable in the carrier. She is 8 months old and we’ve been using it for the past month. I believe the way the carrier is designed is optimal for babies comfort compared to other carriers. She is in a very comfortable seating position compared to other carriers where babies are in a more upright position. 

The carrier also has a very sturdy build. It looks and feels very high quality. 

However I do unfortunately have a complaint. I am rather petite. I mesure about 5’5 and weight 110 lbs. I feel like I can’t quite get the carrier to fit me perfectly. I would need the hip straps to tighten just a little more and the sliding back portion to reach a little lower. I feel like the carrier was mostly designed for men and also fits girls of a more regular build….which is very annoying. A lot of women are my size and we should be able to carry our babies comfortably and enjoy a hike together!
review.name: Great for baby

review.reviewBody: Fast shipping, strong and light material, we're happy, the baby too so it à win win!
review.name: Light

review.reviewBody: Purchased this for my second child after debating for some time, so glad that we did. The difference between this and other carriers for both baby (use it for almost 2 year old & 8 month old) and wearer comfort is impressive, as with all our Thule products the engineering and thought that goes into them is unmatched.
review.name: So comfortable for baby and parent

review.reviewBody: Just hiked 30km over a few days on recent trip to Jasper with my giant 21 lbs 6 months old and this backpack is awesome. Comfy for both me and bubs. Love that it has a wide seat and washable parts. Baby was cozy even in cold and rain. Additional rain cover is great for both rain and cold alpine winds.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We all love this carrier!  Mom, dad, baby and toddler.  It accomodates both our 35 lb 3-year old and 22 lb 1-year old with ease.  It's a versatile product which has become a staple in our family's outdoor life.
review.name: Amazing carrier!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've used several hiking packs over the years, but the Thule Sapling is my very favorite! I've hiked countless miles with it, and have been using it 2-3 times a week for the last 12 months for my 18month old. Here's what makes it stand out from my last child carrier packs:

- COMFORT: This is HUGE. My last child carrier would give me large welts on my hips when carrying a heavy child for longer than 6-7 miles. Last summer I had some long back to back days carrying my heavy child for 14-16 miles each day. I was worried.. but no welts! Also, I believe the cockpit of this is more comfortable than the other types of cockpits on the market. My little guy seems happier to be in here for longer periods of time than in other carriers. The adjustable fit of the pack also accommodates my very tall husband and my frame as well.

Side Openings: The sides of this pack TOTALLY open, to allow for bigger feet/boots to fit. This is different from other packs we've tried! I no longer have to struggle to fit in boots (even ski boots!) of my kiddo no that he's in bigger shoes.

Packs Down: This pack is so easy to travel with- it packs down totally flat! LOVE THIS.

I can't rave about this pack enough! I've been carrying kids almost non-stop for the last 8+ years- I wish I would've had this exact pack from the very beginning.
review.name: My ALL TIME FAVORITE child carrier!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Thule Sapling was the perfect pack for us to carry our little one on hikes, vacation, through the airport, anywhere when we needed to be hands free but bring her along!  We tried a few other backpacks and I think this was the most comfortable for her and us!   The storage in the back was great for trips and the sunshade protected her on hot days.  Highly recommend!
review.name: A must for families on the go!

name: Sapling

review.reviewBody:
I've used eggbeaters on my gravel bike, but never have been brave enough to go clipless on my mountain bike till now. Wanted to stay in the same cleat ecosystem so I could interchange shoes, and these were a perfect introduction. Felt planted like using flats but still the security of being clipped in. My local trails and bike are more XC/DC leaning, but I don't think I'd change to a slimmer pedal because I like the feel of these so much and they're still very light weight.

They were a little stiff to clip in and out of at first, but with some use they loosen up a bit plus I got more used to them. Now I have full confidence in them and am enjoying the clipless experience
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody:
I have used SPD's for a looong time and have always viewed them as the BEST.  I still think they are one of the top pedals out there.  I wanted something to change things up a bit and decided to try the Mallets. I really like these and I like how you just order the cleat that best suits your preference on how much float you want. I have very weak ankles due to a skiing accident from years ago and now that age has crept up on me I need as little resistance as possible when trying to unclip. These fit the bill perfectly. I now have a pair on my full squish and pair waiting to be put on my new hardtail build. 
Long story short, I love these and glad I decided to try them out.
review.name: Converted SPD User

review.reviewBody: Love the control i have with the clippless pedals.    Came from flats and won't go back.    The workmanship on the pedals seem to be very well made.     Not hard to clip in nor is it hard to get unclipped.
review.name: Flats to clippless

review.reviewBody:
Having only gotten into MTB a few years ago and returning from a torn ACL, always felt more comfortable on flats. However, this year I figured I would try the next step in my evolution on buy some clips. Had heard good things about the CB
system and so far so good - extremely easy to clip in and (with most things) a slight learning curve to get out quickly. Bottom line is that I can get up hills with greater ease and don?t fatigue like I would in the past - being able to truly pull the pedal around is a big deal. If you are on the fence or thinking of making the jump to clips, I encourage you to do it with these pedals.
review.name: Switching from Flats
